Enter up to 16 letters and hit search to find all possible words in the currently selected dictionary.

The '_' character is used as a 'blank' or wildcard.

You can enter up to 2 'blanks'.

Enter a word and hit define to find out if it is in the current dictionary and see its definition.

Tapping any result in a search will also allow you to see its definition.

Retrieving definitions requires a network connection.

Include a word or pattern in your search.

First enter your word or pattern, hit include, then optionally enter some specific letters, to your search.

The '_' character is used as a placeholder character depending on context:

If the search consists of a pattern only, '_' will represent a single letter. Great for finding crossword puzzle solutions!

Otherwise, if '_' is at the start or end of the pattern it will represent one or more letters.
If '_' appears between letters it will represent a single letter.

In the settings menu, you can choose which dictionary to use, the order search results should be listed in, and the minimum length of the results.

You can also set whether or not the app can retrieve definitions using network data or on wifi only

Word values are based on Scrabble™ scoring.
